image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: The ACT Court of Appeal overturns a murder conviction for Canberra man Michael O'Connell who was jailed for 15 years over the death of his partner Danielle Jordan in 2022.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for murder wins appeal against his conviction

image.altText: Parkes Way

props.synopsis: Road closures have been causing headaches for motorists in Canberra since construction on the light rail began four years ago. More road closures are coming.

title.children: Think traffic into the CBD is bad? It's about to get worse

image.altText: Bright clothing on display at the National Gallery of Australia

props.synopsis: They were an iconic fashion pair that took Australia by storm, and now 80 designs from the personal collections of Jenny Kee and Linda Jackson are on show at the National Gallery of Australia.

title.children: Jenny Kee and Linda Jackson bring 'iconically Australian' style to gallery

image.altText: Shane Rattenbury speaks behind a host of media microphones.

props.synopsis: Labor's budget plans have been thrown into doubt with the ACT Greens announcing they will not support a proposed $250 health levy, calling it an "unfair and regressive tax".

title.children: 'Back to the drawing board': ACT Greens won't support budget's health levy

image.altText: Leanne Castley in a black jacket.

props.synopsis: ACT Opposition leader Leanne Castley argues Labor's "grand plans" have worsened the territory's budget deficit and reduced the quality of public services.

title.children: 'Real struggle for families': Opposition slams ACT budget as out of touch

image.altText: Tara sits with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne sat through a debate about a motion on women's safety quietly, thinking she wouldn't speak. But then she stood up with conviction and spoke about an incident she'd never talked about before.

title.children: Tara Cheyne reveals stranger sexually assaulted her in broad daylight

image.altText: A man wearing a white jacket walks on the footpath with a woman around his left arm.

props.synopsis: Former Canberra public servant Justin Benn has been sentenced to nearly four years jail for raping and assaulting his former wife.

title.children: Public servant jailed for raping and assaulting wife during relationship

image.altText: A man looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Jailed former military lawyer David McBride has taken his legal battle to the High Court, seeking leave to challenge his conviction.

title.children: McBride lodges High Court application to challenge conviction

image.altText: Black and white image of five soldiers in a trench looking at the camera

props.synopsis: When veterans returned to Australia after the Korean War, they were shunned. Seventy-five years after the conflict started, they're finally getting their moment.

title.children: John served Australia, but his local RSL said 'no'

image.altText: Three Iranian flags fly on flagpoles as fire and smoke rise from buildings

props.synopsis: Experts believe a small, elite team of spies laid the groundwork inside Iran for Israel's Operation Rising Lion.

title.children: Iran attack was 'a long time coming' — but at what legal cost?

image.altText: Jarome Luai of the Tigers holding the ball in two hands, running across field

props.synopsis: Jarome Luai has been ruled out of Wests Tigers' clash with Manly after succumbing to an infection. Later, Canberra will have a chance to go top of the league when they play Newcastle. Follow live.

title.children: Luai injury forces desperate Tigers into reshuffle

image.altText: Police at house

props.synopsis: A Universal Store spokesperson says their sincere thoughts and condolences are with Greg Josephson's family at this very sad time.

title.children: Universal Store co-founder identified as alleged murder victim

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The judge in Erin Patterson's murder trial has warned jurors not to reason that Erin Patterson is guilty just because they think she has lied, as he continues his final instructions to the panel.

title.children: Judge tells Erin Patterson jurors not to find her guilty just because she lied

image.altText: Uniformed NSW Police officer walking through glass sliding doors.

props.synopsis: Online violent extremist group Terrorgram, which was formally listed today as a terror organisation, has been linked to an alleged plot to kill a NSW MP.

title.children: Terrorgram linked to alleged plot to kill Labor politician

image.altText: A black and white close-up of Anna Wintour in a diamond necklace, jacket with her signature bob and dark sunglasses

props.synopsis: As Anna Wintour steps down as editor of US Vogue after almost 40 years in the role, one thing seems clear: her legacy is as astonishing as her rise.

title.children: Anna Wintour redefined fashion. Her legacy is as astonishing as her rise

image.altText: A sign on a brick wall reads 'Western Sydney University', in the distance are some large buildings.

props.synopsis: After a Sydney university was warned for allowing sanctioned Iranian state broadcaster PressTV on campus, Liberal senator Dave Sharma says it should not be the university enforcing sanctions, but DFAT.

title.children: Sharma says sanctions warning to university 'shooting the messenger'

image.altText: An elderly woman with short, white hair.

props.synopsis: Judges have reserved their decision on whether to allow the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions to appeal a sentence given to a former police officer over the death of 95-year-old Clare Nowland.

title.children: Court hears Kristian White gave 95yo 'no way' to avoid being tasered

image.altText: A man in a grey pullover sits in back seat of police car covering his face with his hands.

props.synopsis: Japan hangs the "Twitter killer" who murdered and dismembered nine people he met online, in the nation's first enactment of the death penalty since 2022.

title.children: 'Twitter killer' who murdered nine hanged in Japan's first execution since 2022

image.altText: Indonesian police escorting a criminal

props.synopsis: Police say that two Australians are suspected of arriving on a scooter and opening fire, and another of facilitating the crime.

title.children: Indonesian police reveal more details of fatal shooting of Australian man in Bali

image.altText: A collage of two men, one in prison greens and the other in prison orange

props.synopsis: When a bloodied man ran from a townhouse in an affluent New York neighbourhood, he revealed a complex and grisly tale of alleged cryptocurrency kidnapping.

title.children: Two crypto kings entered a luxe NYC home — then came a bloody kidnapping, police say

image.altText: A man in suit sitting at a table with his hands crossed at the desk.

props.synopsis: Five New South Wales political staffers give evidence on Friday, one week after they risked arrest for failing to appear.

title.children: Tensions flare as NSW premier's staffers grilled at hoax terror plot inquiry

image.altText: A graphic shows David Crisafulli alongside receipt snippets, laid over the SET Solutions website.

props.synopsis: A Queensland parliamentary committee has cleared David Crisafulli of wrongdoing.

title.children: Committee finds premier failed to declare $200,000 payment to liquidators

image.altText: Ilotopie performers coated head to toe in pink photorapher from behind, feat their naked bottoms painted pink

props.synopsis: Thirty years after they were thrown into an Adelaide prison for public nudity, legendary French street artists Ilotopie returned to the scene of the crime — as nude, and as proud, as ever.

title.children: Naked street artists return 30 years after arrests

image.altText: Cuts of beef sit displayed in a butcher.

props.synopsis: Less than a decade after the red meat industry promised to reach net-zero emissions by 2030, it abandons the goal claiming it is not possible.

title.children: Cattle industry walks away from net-zero target by 2030 pledge

image.altText: A tall building behind a tree in the foreground.

props.synopsis: There's a desperate need for more social housing to help solve the property crisis — but the WA government's acquisition of an East Perth apartment complex shows there's also a delicate balance.

title.children: $105m apartment complex bought to help fix housing crisis reveals curly problem

image.altText: Lorde in the triple j studio for an interview around her 2025 album Virgin.

props.synopsis: On her highly anticipated fourth album, the New Zealand pop sensation challenges both her and our understanding of modern femininity.

title.children: 'I was trying to make an album that didn't lie': Lorde on her raw new record

image.altText: Megan Lee sits reading a book next to her son

props.synopsis: A recent poll shows 44 per cent of Australians who drink alcohol want to drink less or stop altogether. And getting started can feel hard. But there are strategies to help.

title.children: 'I didn't like my relationship with alcohol': Tips for drinking less

image.altText: an inflatible boat full of people in shallow water.

props.synopsis: Passengers on an upmarket cruise along the Kimberley coast suffered twisted ankles and "lots of scrapes" when a fast-falling tide stranded them and crew off a remote island.

title.children: Passengers suffer minor injuries after being stranded off remote WA coast

image.altText: Oscar Piastri celebrates winning Formula 1 Spanish Grand Prix, standing on his car with his arm raised in triumph

props.synopsis: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says all he wants is "a fair opportunity" in his quest to become world champion.

title.children: 'Can only be one': Piastri wants a fair go at the F1 world title

image.altText: Bagpipers in front of a billboard of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith.

props.synopsis: Mourners at the police funeral for Constable Keith Smith have been told he "made a real difference in the lives of everyday Tasmanians".

title.children: 'He was always the good cop': Family, police colleagues farewell Keith Smith

image.altText: Shamar Joseph bites his white jersey with his hands on his hips.

props.synopsis: The West Indies have every right to feel aggrieved after a number of third umpire decisions went against the home side during the first Test against Australia at the Kensington Oval.

title.children: 'Flabbergasted': The decisions that went against the West Indies

image.altText: A tail of a plane that crashed is seen stuck on a building

props.synopsis: India's Civil Aviation Ministry says the analysis of black boxes aims to "reconstruct the sequence of events" to find out the cause of the worst aviation disaster in a decade.

title.children: Investigators begin to analyse black box data from fatal Air India crash

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia wears a black t-shirt and Chicago Bulls cap.

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department says it intends to try Kilmar Abrego Garcia on federal smuggling charges before it moves to deport him.

title.children: Trump administration plans to re-deport Abrego Garcia

image.altText: A banner hanging on a bridge in Venice that says no space for Bezos

props.synopsis: From Donald Trump's shock profanity to Jeff Bezos moving his wedding due to angry protesters, it has been another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's shock profanity, hungry bears and a billionaire's wedding woes

image.altText: Charles Sturt University signage.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest regional universities has confirmed it plans to cut jobs in order to save about $35 million in the wake of an almost 90 per cent drop in international student enrolments.

title.children: Uni to slash jobs due to 90 per cent drop in overseas students
